en.Encounter_Random_Message130: Explorer's journal. New Entry. It's gone. It's all gone.
en.Encounter_Random_Message131: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Cars litter the roads. None drivable.
en.Encounter_Random_Message132: Explorer's journal. New Entry. So many skeletons. The world is a grave.
en.Encounter_Random_Message133: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Some pre-war food is still edible. Preservatives.
en.Encounter_Random_Message134: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Law and order are things of the past.
en.Encounter_Random_Message135: Explorer's journal. New Entry. The world is still largely irradiated.
en.Encounter_Random_Message136: Explorer's journal. New Entry. The flora and fauna all seem pretty... weird.
en.Encounter_Random_Message137: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Life thrives where it can out here.
en.Encounter_Random_Message138: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Many buildings remain. Damage extensive.
en.Encounter_Random_Message139: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Most water undrinkable. Too much radiation.
en.Encounter_Random_Message140: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Bottle Caps accepted as currency everywhere.
en.Encounter_Random_Message141: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Slavers prey on the weak. My heart breaks.
en.Encounter_Random_Message142: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Food is scarce. Some resort to cannibalism.
en.Encounter_Random_Message143: Explorer's journal. New Entry. A Yao Guai is a fierce, mutated bear.
en.Encounter_Random_Message144: Explorer's journal. New Entry. A Ghoul is an irradiated human. Disfigured.
en.Encounter_Random_Message145: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Raiders are everywhere. Stealing. Murdering.
en.Encounter_Random_Message146: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Feral Ghouls are basically zombies. Must avoid.
en.Encounter_Random_Message147: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Mole rats are NOT cute...
en.Encounter_Random_Message148: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Super Mutants hate humans. They'll kill on sight.
en.Encounter_Random_Message149: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Giant ants are, indeed, giant ants.
en.Encounter_Random_Message15: The Vault is counting on me. I won't let them down.
en.Encounter_Random_Message150: Explorer's journal. New Entry. Radroaches. They really can survive anything.
en.Encounter_Random_Message151: Explorer's journal. New Entry. The military is gone. Replaced by mercenaries.
en.Encounter_Random_Message152: Explorer's journal. New entry. Most dogs no longer man's best friend.
en.Encounter_Random_Message153: Explorer's journal. New entry. Squirrel tastes much better than you'd think.
en.Encounter_Random_Message154: Explorer's journal. New entry. Thought I saw a UFO, but that would be impossible...
en.Encounter_Random_Message155: Explorer's journal. New entry. Sea creatures now extremely dangerous. Still delicious.
en.Encounter_Random_Message156: Explorer's journal. New entry. Sunsets, once romantic, are now terrifying. Fear the night.
en.Encounter_Random_Message157: Explorer's journal. New entry. So very hungry. Wondering if human tastes like chicken.
en.Encounter_Random_Message158: Explorer's journal. New entry. Super Mutants are big. Behemoths, more so.
en.Encounter_Random_Message159: Explorer's journal. New entry. Money replaced by soda bottle Caps. Hands always sticky.
en.Encounter_Random_Message16: Clouds on the horizon. Hope it doesn't rain.
en.Encounter_Random_Message160: Explorer's journal. New entry. The comics were wrong. Radiation does not grant super powers.
en.Encounter_Random_Message161: Explorer's journal. New entry. Love does not conquer all. Nukes come close.
en.Encounter_Random_Message162: Explorer's journal. New entry. Bigger not always better. Case in point – roaches and scorpions.
en.Encounter_Random_Message163: Explorer's journal. New entry. Super Mutants are asexual. Before transformation, some were women.
en.Encounter_Random_Message164: Explorer's journal. New entry. Junk is everywhere, but has multiple uses.
en.Encounter_Random_Message165: Explorer's journal. New entry. Power Armor still exists, but is rare. Affords maximum protection.
en.Encounter_Random_Message166: Explorer's journal. New entry. Found a fat man willing to share food. May live another day.
en.Encounter_Random_Message167: Explorer's journal. New entry. Many Mister Handy robots remain. Use expressions like, “bloody barmy.”
en.Encounter_Random_Message168: Explorer's journal. New entry. Fruits and vegetables still grow, but are mutated, like so much else.
en.Encounter_Random_Message169: Explorer's journal. New entry. Homemade weapons abound. Humans still excel at killing each other.
en.Encounter_Random_Message17: I'll follow this road, see where it goes.
en.Encounter_Random_Message170: Explorer's journal. New entry. Radio still widely used, remains an effective means of communication.
en.Encounter_Random_Message171: Explorer's journal. New entry. We were wrong – cats not, in fact, extinct. But still lazy.
en.Encounter_Random_Message172: Is that... a human head on a post? Okay, time to turn around...
en.Encounter_Random_Message173: I may be scared senseless, but at least I'm getting some cardio.
en.Encounter_Random_Message175: Huh. What's that flashing thing? How is OH MY GOD I'M IN A MINEFIELD. Sloowwwlly now...
en.Encounter_Random_Message176: Oh look, a destroyed pizzeria. Maybe we can have a Vault pizza night when I get back...
en.Encounter_Random_Message177: There's ancient money everywhere. Guess you really can't take it with you.
en.Encounter_Random_Message178: An old Army transport. Looks like the soldiers tried to keep order. For a little while.
en.Encounter_Random_Message18: A crossroads. Left or right? Let's try left.
en.Encounter_Random_Message181: Might as well head down here.
en.Encounter_Random_Message183: So tired of walking. My kingdom for a bicycle.
en.Encounter_Random_Message184: All things considered, this expedition's going pretty well.
en.Encounter_Random_Message185: Hello? Heeeelllooo? Nope. Guess I'm alone.
en.Encounter_Random_Message186: You know, it's really not so bad out here. Sometimes.
en.Encounter_Random_Message187: Rad detector's going crazy. Must be those green barrels...
en.Encounter_Random_Message188: Whoa! Tripped. Gotta be more careful.
en.Encounter_Random_Message189: Think I'll just walk over here and OW! Twisted my ankle!
en.Encounter_Random_Message19: A crossroads. Left or right? I guess I'll go right.
en.Encounter_Random_Message190: All these destroyed cars, but they never flew. Guess science missed that boat.
en.Encounter_Random_Message191: It's... a motorboat. Stuck into the side of a church. Don't see that every day.
en.Encounter_Random_Message192: I wonder if elephants still exist.
en.Encounter_Random_Message193: May as well follow this blood trail. What could possibly go wrong?
en.Encounter_Random_Message194: Thirsty. Wonder if I can find a bottle of Nuka-Cola.
en.Encounter_Random_Message195: A terminal. Really wish I could hack it!
en.Encounter_Random_Message196: Hmm. A chest. Really wish I could pick the lock. I bet there's some great stuff inside.
en.Encounter_Random_Message197: A broken bottle, spent ammo casings, drops of blood... Definitely signs of a fight.
en.Encounter_Random_Message198: I feel exposed. Time to get into cover.
en.Encounter_Random_Message199: Got a weird feeling. Like I'm being watched...
en.Encounter_Random_Message2: I really should be drawing a map.
en.Encounter_Random_Message20: It sure gets lonely out here.
en.Encounter_Random_Message200: Should I be walking out in the open like this? Or sneaking? I can never tell.
en.Encounter_Random_Message201: Gunshots to the east. Guess I'll go west.
en.Encounter_Random_Message202: Gunshots to the west. Guess I'll go east.
en.Encounter_Random_Message203: Gunshots to the north. Guess I'll go south.
en.Encounter_Random_Message204: Gunshots to the south. Guess I'll go north.
en.Encounter_Random_Message205: Is that... a child? Nope... just the severed head of a doll. Wonderful.
en.Encounter_Random_Message206: I really hope I can find my way back to the Vault...
en.Encounter_Random_Message207: Wow, that's a really big pile of rubble. I think I can make it over...
en.Encounter_Random_Message208: So many big buildings. I wonder if they'll remain standing... forever.
en.Encounter_Random_Message209: I hear a child crying. Impossible to tell where it's coming from.
en.Encounter_Random_Message21: Should I head back to the Vault? Maybe in a bit.
en.Encounter_Random_Message210: I wonder if Brahmin milk is any good. Not that I want to find out.
en.Encounter_Random_Message212: Think I'll Wait, what's that? Over there?
en.Encounter_Random_Message214: Too much rubble. Don't think I can get up there.
en.Encounter_Random_Message215: Hmm. Subway station. I don't think I want to go down there.
en.Encounter_Random_Message216: A car tunnel. Sure is dark in there. I think I'll go around.
en.Encounter_Random_Message218: A broken rifle on the ground. Useless.
en.Encounter_Random_Message221: I can do this. I can do this. I can do this.
en.Encounter_Random_Message24: I'll climb that ridge and get the lay of the land.
en.Encounter_Random_Message26: Just got to keep moving forward.
en.Encounter_Random_Message27: I'd be totally lost without my Pip-Boy.
en.Encounter_Random_Message28: Broken branches. Something passed through here.
en.Encounter_Random_Message29: Nowhere to go but straight ahead.
en.Encounter_Random_Message30: Fresh tracks. Can't tell what made them.
en.Encounter_Random_Message31: I bet this neighborhood was nice once.
en.Encounter_Random_Message32: Hard to imagine people actually living out here.
en.Encounter_Random_Message33: The more supplies I bring back to the Vault, the better.
en.Encounter_Random_Message34: I'm going to have such blisters tomorrow...
en.Encounter_Random_Message35: I'll head that way. Might be something interesting.
en.Encounter_Random_Message38: Should I go that way? Hmmm. No, I'll go this way.
en.Encounter_Random_Message39: Wonder if someone will give me a massage when I get back.
en.Encounter_Random_Message4: Legs are cramping. But I must go on.
en.Encounter_Random_Message41: If the others could only see how bad it is for themselves...
en.Encounter_Random_Message42: Sky looks funny over there. Storm might be coming.
en.Encounter_Random_Message43: A fork in the road. Guess I'll go left.
en.Encounter_Random_Message44: A fork in the road. Guess I'll go right.
en.Encounter_Random_Message45: Think I'll go down this path.
en.Encounter_Random_Message47: Hmm... Broken plants. Someone pass by here?
en.Encounter_Random_Message48: Never knew I could sweat so much!
en.Encounter_Random_Message49: This sure is good exercise, if nothing else.
en.Encounter_Random_Message52: Traveling alone sure is, well... lonely.
en.Encounter_Random_Message53: Need to bring supplies back to the Vault. Focus on that...
en.Encounter_Random_Message54: All this walking is murder on my feet.
en.Encounter_Random_Message55: Good thing I'm wearing sensible footwear!
en.Encounter_Random_Message56: Calves, thighs, knees - they're all hurting.
en.Encounter_Random_Message58: I'll head back to the Vault. But not yet. Not yet...
en.Encounter_Random_Message59: When I get back to the Vault, they'll hail me as a hero!
en.Encounter_Random_Message60: Looks like a lake. Definitely don't want to go swimming in THAT.
en.Encounter_Random_Message61: On the ground. Is that dried... blood?
en.Encounter_Random_Message62: Looks like a trail of paint. Oh, wait. Nope. That's blood.
en.Encounter_Random_Message64: Okay, I'll admit it. I'm terrified.
en.Encounter_Random_Message65: I won't give in to my fear. I won't give in to my fear.
en.Encounter_Random_Message66: I'd whistle a tune, but my mouth is too dry.
en.Encounter_Random_Message67: If I get lost out here, I'm in serious trouble.
en.Encounter_Random_Message68: People actually live out here? Ugh.
en.Encounter_Random_Message69: Oh, that's a nice little house. Or at least it was.
en.Encounter_Random_Message7: This way looks as good as any other.
en.Encounter_Random_Message70: Looks like an old store. Wonder what they sold?
en.Encounter_Random_Message71: Oh look, an old bus stop. Sure wish I could catch a ride.
en.Encounter_Random_Message72: Am I talking to myself? I think I am. Uh oh.
en.Encounter_Random_Message73: An old elementary school. Wow, that's not depressing at all...
en.Encounter_Random_Message75: Think I'll head that way for awhile.
en.Encounter_Random_Message77: An old coffee shop. Sure could go for a cup of joe right about now.
en.Encounter_Random_Message78: Is that...an old Nuka-Cola factory? Too bad it's destroyed.
en.Encounter_Random_Message79: I hear chanting. Probably some crazy cult. Better keep my distance.
en.Encounter_Random_Message8: Sure wish I had a traveling buddy.
en.Encounter_Random_Message80: An old hospital. Looks like it's been picked clean.
en.Encounter_Random_Message81: Some old department store. No clothes left.
en.Encounter_Random_Message82: Oh look, an old baseball diamond. Nobody's run those bases in a long time.
en.Encounter_Random_Message83: Hasn't been a touchdown in that old football field in two hundred years.
en.Encounter_Random_Message84: Looks like debris from an old plane crash.
en.Encounter_Random_Message85: An old, crashed vertibird. From the Army, before the war.
en.Encounter_Random_Message86: Now that is one big house. Still couldn't stop an atomic bomb.
en.Encounter_Random_Message87: A drained swimming pool filled with skeletons. Lovely.
en.Encounter_Random_Message88: I think that building was... a hotel? An apartment complex?
en.Encounter_Random_Message89: A rusty old playground. So sad.
en.Encounter_Random_Message9: Have I started talking to myself? I can't tell.
en.Encounter_Random_Message91: Need to control my breathing. Stay calm.
en.Encounter_Random_Message94: Time for a break? Maybe later.
en.Encounter_Random_Message96: The Overseer made the right choice, choosing me for this.
en.Encounter_Random_Message97: The longer I'm out here, the more danger I'm in.
en.Encounter_Random_Message98: I can feel my heart racing.
en.Encounter_Random_Message99: Just being out here gives me an adrenaline rush!
en.Encounter_SurpriseQuest_AbandonedHouse: I found an Abandoned Cabin and went inside.
en.Encounter_SurpriseQuest_MarketPlace: I searched through a Super Duper Mart I came across.
en.Encounter_SurpriseQuest_RedRocket: I discovered and explored a Red Rocket Truck Stop.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature1: I did it. The Savage Dog is dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature10: I killed the Radscorpion. I can hardly believe it.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature11: It was a tough fight but I managed to kill the Giant Soldier Ant.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature13: I killed the Guard Dog before it could alert anyone to my presence.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature14: I barely managed to kill the Fire Ant Warrior.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature15: The Mirelurk is armored everywhere but the face, so I used that to my advantage. It's dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature16: That's one Feral Ghoul Roamer whose roaming days are done.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature17: I'm not quite sure how I managed it, but the Giant Radscorpion is dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature18: The Mirelurk Hunter became the hunted. It's dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature19: It was close, but I killed the Vicious Dog.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature2: The Mole rat has been killed.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature20: I put the Centaur out of its misery.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature21: It was a nasty fight, but the Feral Ghoul Reaver is dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature22: I killed the Deathclaw! That was way too close...
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature23: I killed the Enclave Deathclaw. At least now it's free.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature25: I'm beaten and bloodied, but the Super Mutant Master is dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature26: We went toe-to-toe, but the Super Mutant Overlord is finally dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature27: I did it. I killed the Behemoth. I think I'm in shock...
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature3: I killed the Bloatfly and it exploded into a thousand pieces. Disgusting.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature4: I squashed the Radroach, no problem.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature5: It was a tough fight, but I killed the Yao Guai.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature6: I killed the Feral Ghoul. It was him or me.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature7: I've got some cuts and bruises, but the Giant Ant is dead.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature8: I killed the Scavenger's Dog. Sad, but I had no choice.
en.Encounter_Victory_Creature9: The Giant Worker Ant is dead. That was a close one.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location1: I found an unlocked door into the Broadcasting Tower. There was a supply cache inside.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location10: I found a working coffee machine! Maybe just one cup...
en.Encounter_Victory_Location11: I managed to enter and explore the National Guard Depot.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location12: I managed to make some friends. It's amazing what the right words can do.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location13: I made enough explosives to clear the area! Now I can keep exploring.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location14: I fled through the back door and tripped on a hollowed-out rock filled with supplies.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location15: Held my breath long enough to find a supply room with a few things above water.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location16: I chopped the door to pieces and found a large supply closet.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location17: I spotted Mirelurks hiding down there, so I turned back and searched the Brewery again.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location2: I successfully hid from the Raiders. That was close.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location3: I found a hidden box of supplies!
en.Encounter_Victory_Location4: I got the Refrigerator open. There were some supplies inside.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location5: I cracked the Safe! Looks like there's some good stuff inside...
en.Encounter_Victory_Location6: Got the door open and explored the Super Duper Mart. I stocked up on supplies.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location7: The Slaves recognized me as friendly. We chatted for a bit, then they moved on.
en.Encounter_Victory_Location8: I helped a dozen slaves escape. To freedom!
en.Encounter_Victory_Location9: I found some unopened crates in a storage closet.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC1: I patched up the Slave's Leg. He's back on the run. I wish him the best.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC10: I managed to repair the Mister Handy. He told me a pretty funny joke in exchange.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC2: I stopped the bleeding and calmed him down. Looks like he's going to make it.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC3: The Ghoul gave me supplies... and some much needed friendship.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC4: We struck a deal, and parted on good terms.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC5: I put the Talon Company Mercs at ease. We traded stories, and parted as friends.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC6: I helped the Hunter locate and kill the Yao Guai.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC7: The Drunken Drifter passed out. More for me!
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC8: The Brotherhood Patrol took pity on me and gave me some supplies.
en.Encounter_Victory_NPC9: I successfully brought the Lost Farmer to the settlement. He's safe now.
en.Encounter_Victory_Repeatable_JunkLocatio: I got them off and went inside to stock up.
They're now as docile as lambs, so I can continue exploring the Cave.
Got ahold of the reins and stopped the Brahmin! The Merchant then gave me a reward.
I bumped my foot against something and unearthed it to find a pre-war time capsule!
What luck! I found and raided a supply room without making the building collapse.
I grit my teeth and got it before the Lake's radiation made me sick.
I found the password! Looks like there's a Workshop inside...
I managed to avoid all the traps and found a well-stocked storage room.
They let me in, gave me some food, and let me help myself to their junk pile.
They never knew I was there! I even helped myself to some loot.
I noticed a subtle breeze and followed it to a secret room!
Boom! I turned a laser arm into a one-shot door opener. Now to look inside...
en.Entrance_Upgrade_Info: Increases the health of the Vault door
en.Erase_Save_Slot_Confirm: Are you sure you want to erase this Vault?
en.Erase_Save_Slot_Double_Confirm: Any items acquired from Lunchboxes in this Vault will be permanently lost. Are you sure you want to delete this Vault?
en.Facebook_HelpRequest_Message: Here's the Junk you asked for!
en.Facebook_SendGift_Message: Here's some Junk for you. I hope it helps!
en.Help_Page01_BottomText: Hint: Some objectives will reward you with Lunchboxes!
en.Help_Page01_MainText: There are always three objectives you can work on.<lf><lf>You can abandon one Objective each day and receive a new Objective in its place.<lf><lf>Harder objectives give better rewards.
en.Help_Page02_BottomText: Hint: Luck stat affects the probability of earning CAPS when collecting Resources.
en.Help_Page02_MainText: Every Dweller has stats called SPECIAL<lf><lf>S (trength)<lf>P (erception)<lf>E (ndurance)<lf>C (harisma)<lf>I (ntelligence)<lf>A (gility)<lf>L (uck) <lf><lf>Every room in the Vault is linked to one of the SPECIAL stats. The better the Dweller's stat is for that room, the more they influence the room's effects.
en.Help_Page03_BottomText: Hint: Find RARE and LEGENDARY Dwellers in Lunchboxes.
en.Help_Page03_MainText: LEVEL <lf>Dwellers level up over time while working in Production Rooms or when exploring the Wasteland.<lf><lf>Leveling up increases the health of a Dweller. The higher their level is, the higher their health. <lf>Rooms unlock based on how many Dwellers you have in your Vault.<lf><lf>DWELLER'S RARITY<lf><lf>There are three types of rarity of Dwellers, COMMON, RARE, and LEGENDARY.<lf><lf>- COMMON: Low level and SPECIAL stats<lf><lf>- RARE: Average level and SPECIAL stats<lf><lf>- LEGENDARY: High level and SPECIAL stats
en.Help_Page04_BottomText: Hint: The higher the Dweller's level, the more CAPS their revival will cost.
en.Help_Page04_MainText: A Dweller dies when their health is depleted.<lf><lf>To avoid Dwellers dying you can:<lf>- Give them a Stimpak to Heal them.<lf>- Give them a RadAway to remove Radiation.<lf>- A dead Dweller can be revived with CAPS, or removed from your Vault.
en.Help_Page05_BottomText: Hint: Pay close attention to what a Dweller is telling you to know more about what makes them happy.
en.Help_Page05_MainText: Depending on what you ask your Dwellers to do, they can become happy or sad.<lf><lf>Keeping Dwellers happy is very important! A happy Vault runs more efficiently and produces resources faster.<lf>You can see a specific Dweller's happiness by checking their profile.<lf><lf>Happiness Icon status:<lf><lf>GREEN: Your Dweller is happy, way to go!<lf><lf>YELLOW: Your Dweller is doing okay, but could be happier.<lf><lf>RED: Your Dweller is sad, cheer them up!
en.Help_Page06_BottomText: Hint: Playing for 7 days gives you a Lunchbox as a reward.
en.Help_Page06_MainText: Every day you receive a reward based on how happy your Vault is.<lf><lf>- Your Vault rating is the combined total of all your Dwellers happiness. <lf><lf>- Your reward is based on your Vault Rating.<lf><lf>- A high Vault Rating earns you bonus CAPS.
en.Help_Page07_BottomText: Hint: Babies will wait to be born if there is no space in your Vault.
en.Help_Page07_MainText: When you need new Dwellers you can always encourage your Dwellers to procreate.<lf><lf>- Put a man and a woman in the Living Quarters and see if they like each other.<lf><lf>- If all goes well, the woman will become pregnant.<lf><lf>- After some time, the pregnant Dweller will be ready to give birth.<lf><lf>- Tap the icon above her head to welcome a new child in your Vault.<lf><lf>- Once the child has grown up, you will have a new Dweller.
en.Help_Page07_MainText_PC: When you need new Dwellers you can always encourage your Dwellers to procreate.<lf><lf>- Put a man and a woman in the Living Quarters and see if they like each other.<lf><lf>- If all goes well, the woman will become pregnant.<lf><lf>- After some time, the pregnant Dweller will be ready to give birth.<lf><lf>- Click on the icon above her head to welcome a new child in your Vault.<lf><lf>- Once the child has grown up, you will have a new Dweller.
en.Help_Page08_BottomText: Hint: Be careful not to build rooms before you need them, or expand too fast.
en.Help_Page08_MainText: Build Living Quarters to welcome new Dwellers to your Vault.<lf><lf>- Expand your Vault by building rooms so you can produce more resources.<lf><lf>- Pay attention to the Vault Resource Gauges, they are a good indicator to follow when choosing the next room to build.<lf><lf>- Build an Elevator when you want to expand downwards.<lf><lf>- You can not delete a room if it is connected on both sides.<lf><lf>- Building multiple types of the same room will increase its price.
en.Help_Page09_BottomText: Hint: A room merge only happens if all rooms are of the same level.
en.Help_Page09_MainText: Upgrade your Rooms to increase their performance.<lf><lf>- Most Rooms can be upgraded twice. Upgraded resource rooms produce more resources.<lf><lf>- Up to 3 Rooms of the same type can be merged, by building them next to each other<lf><lf>- Merged Rooms let you assign more Dwellers to the room, while also becoming more efficient.<lf><lf>- Some rooms, like Workshops, begin as larger rooms and cannot be merged.
en.Help_Page10_BottomText: Hint: If you run out of storage space, upgrade your storage, build more storage, equip your Dwellers or sell items.
en.Help_Page10_MainText: Storage Rooms increase your Weapons, Outfit, Junk and Pets inventory space.<lf><lf>- Upgrade your Storage Rooms to increase inventory capacity.<lf><lf>- Sell unwanted items by visiting the inventory from the Pip-Boy menu.<lf><lf>- Scrap Weapons and Outfits to turn them into Junk from their Recipes.<lf><lf>- Use the Storage Room as a temporary holding bay for Dwellers in case all other Rooms are full.<lf><lf>- Building MedBays and Science Labs will increase the number of Stimpaks and RadAways you can store.
en.Help_Page10_MainText_3DTouch: Storage Rooms increase your Weapons, Outfit, Junk and Pets inventory space.<lf><lf>- Upgrade your Storage Rooms to increase inventory capacity.<lf><lf>- Sell unwanted items by visiting the inventory from the Pip-Boy menu. You can also open the inventory with 3D Touch by pressing on a Storage Room.<lf><lf>- Scrap Weapons and Outfits to turn them into Junk from their Recipes.<lf><lf>- Use the Storage Room as a temporary holding bay for Dwellers in case all other Rooms are full.<lf><lf>- Building MedBays and Science Labs will increase the number of Stimpaks and RadAways you can store.
en.Help_Page11_BottomText: Hint: Multiple Dwellers training together in the same room decrease the training time for all Dwellers in the room.
en.Help_Page11_MainText: Putting Dwellers in a Training Room will increase their SPECIAL stats.<lf><lf>There is a Training Room for each one of the SPECIAL stats.<lf><lf>Strength: Weight Room<lf>Perception: Armory<lf>Endurance: Fitness Room<lf>Charisma: Lounge<lf>Intelligence: Classroom<lf>Agility: Athletics Room <lf>Luck: Game Room<lf><lf>You can raise each stat up to 10.<lf><lf>The higher the SPECIAL stat of a Dweller is, the longer it takes them to train to the next level.
en.Help_Page12_BottomText: Hint: Merging the Radio Room increases your chances of attracting a Dweller.
en.Help_Page12_MainText: The Radio Room attracts new Dwellers from the Wasteland.<lf><lf>- Periodically, Radio Rooms send out a call for new Dwellers. There's a chance that the call will be answered.<lf><lf>- When the timer in the Radio Room reaches zero, if a new Dweller doesn't answer the call, the timer will restart automatically.<lf><lf>- Assign Dwellers with high Charisma to a Radio Room to speed up the Radio Call.<lf><lf>- Upgrade your Radio Room to increase the chance of attracting Dwellers.<lf><lf>- Having Dwellers in the Radio Room also provides a happiness boost to your Vault.
en.Help_Page13_BottomText: Hint: Rushing a room is the fastest way to earn CAPS.
en.Help_Page13_MainText: There are lots of ways you can earn CAPS.<lf>- Find them in the Wasteland<lf>- Complete Objectives<lf>- Leveling up Dwellers<lf>- Selling items<lf>- Every Lunchbox contains CAPS<lf>- Lucky Dwellers earn them occasionally while collecting resources <lf><lf>CAPS can be spent to:<lf>- Build Rooms and elevators<lf>- Destroy rocks <lf>- Upgrade Rooms<lf>- Revive Dwellers<lf>- Craft Weapons and Outfits<lf>- Customize Dwellers
en.Help_Page14_BottomText: Hint: The percentage chance of a disaster cools down over time.
en.Help_Page14_MainText: Production Rooms can be Rushed to earn CAPS and to instantly earn resources.<lf><lf>- Rush completes the current production cycle and award a bonus amount of CAPS.<lf><lf>- The CAPS bonus is based on the Risk value. The higher the risk is, the greater the amount of CAPS you earn.<lf><lf>- Failing a Rush causes a disaster in the room.
en.Help_Page15_BottomText: Hint: A Dweller in the Wasteland can be Revived for CAPS.
en.Help_Page15_MainText: Dispatch your Dwellers to scavenge the Wasteland. <lf><lf>Out there they will find CAPS, earn Experience, and bring back Weapons and Outfits. The further out they go, the better the rewards they'll find, but the harder the encounters will become.<lf><lf>- Drag a Dweller to the Wasteland and equip them with Outfits, Weapons, RadAways and Stimpaks.<lf><lf>- Send them out exploring, but don't forget to check on their progress.<lf><lf>- Dwellers can be recalled from the Wasteland at any time, and take half as long to return from the Wasteland.<lf><lf>- Make sure you bring them home before they die!<lf><lf>- Dwellers automatically return from the Wasteland if they can't carry any more items.<lf><lf>- Dwellers in the Wasteland may stumble upon a special location. Tap the exclamation point icon to choose between entering this location or continuing to explore the Wasteland.
en.Help_Page16_BottomText: Hint: Rare and Legendary Dwellers can be found in Lunchboxes and have great stats.
en.Help_Page16_MainText: Fast-track your progress with Vault-Tec's amazing Lunchboxes.<lf><lf>DWELLERS - Need more Dwellers, fast? Each Lunchbox has a chance of containing a Dweller. <lf><lf>WEAPONS - All the finest in Wasteland survival from BB guns to the powerful Fat Man. <lf><lf>OUTFITS - Equip your Dwellers in these stat boosting, and stylish, outfits. <lf><lf>PETS - Find a faithful companion that will help your Dwellers and liven up your Vault.  <lf><lf>JUNK - Use these long-forgotten objects to craft items in your Workshops.<lf><lf>RESOURCES - Stock up on resources with CAPS, RadAway, Stimpaks, Extra Food, Power or Water<lf><lf>Every Lunchbox can give you COMMON, RARE, or LEGENDARY items. Each Lunchbox is guaranteed to either have a Dweller or a RARE item.
en.Help_Page17_BottomText: Hint: Equipping your Dwellers with Weapons will help fight off enemies.
en.Help_Page17_MainText: Disasters can randomly strike your Vault at any time! Disasters also occur when you fail a room Rush. Watch out for these possible encounters:<lf><lf>FIRES - Put out fires quickly before they spread to other rooms.<lf><lf>RADROACHES - These pesky critters are hard to get rid of. Take them out before they spread.<lf><lf>RAIDERS - Raiders will rush through your Vault and destroy its resources, stop them quickly! Stronger Raiders will even steal CAPS if you're not careful! Upgrading your Vault Entrance will delay Raiders, giving you time to prepare. Putting guards in your Vault Entrance will also provide a front line of defense against the Raiders. You can loot dead Raiders for CAPS and items!<lf><lf>MOLE RATS – These pests are a nuisance and have a nasty habit of burrowing into your Vault from the dirt and chewing on any room's power cables. Kill them quickly, or they'll drain your Vault of Power!<lf><lf>DEATHCLAWS – Any time you open your Vault Door, you're broadcasting an invitation for these beasties to come to your Vault and destroy your resources. Be sure to have Stimpaks and Weapons at the ready, or they'll tear through your Dwellers like a knife through a Fancy Lad Snack Cake! <lf><lf>GHOULS - Ghouls run through your vault, wreaking havoc by dealing both physical and radiation damage to the Dwellers they attack.<lf><lf>RADSCORPIONS – These mutated scorpions are able to burrow and attack random rooms in your vault. Make sure to kill them quickly as their attacks also do radiation damage!<lf><lf>Children and Pregnant Women will hide whenever an incident occurs.
en.Help_Page18_BottomText: Hint: The Dweller Menu icon shows the number of Dwellers in your Vault, as well as how many Dwellers you have waiting outside.
en.Help_Page18_MainText: 1. Wasteland - Tap outside your Vault to pull up your Wasteland Logs.<lf>2. Dweller Menu - Use this for easy sorting and selection of your Dwellers.<lf>3. Happiness - Your overall Vault Happiness. Tap on it to see what bonuses it provides to your Vault.<lf>4. Resource Bars - Your current resource amounts. Don't let them fall below the required resources lines, or your Vault will start to deteriorate. Tap to see how many resources you have.<lf>5. CAPS - Tap on the CAPS to go to the Lunchbox Store.<lf>6. Build Hammer - Tap on the Build Hammer to build rooms.<lf>7. Pip-Boy - Tap the Pip-Boy to open the Pip-Boy menu. A number on the Pip-Boy means you have Lunchboxes to open. An exclamation point means you have Objective rewards to collect.<lf>8. Lunchboxes - Tap the Lunchboxes to go to the Lunchbox menu. A number means you have Lunchboxes to open.<lf>9. Objectives - Tap the ribbon to go to your Objectives page. An exclamation point means you have Objective rewards to collect.<lf>10. Inventory - Tap the boxes to go to the Inventory menu.<lf>11. VDSG - Tap the book to open the Vault Dweller Surivival Guide.<lf>12. Settings - Tap the gears to go to the settings menu.
en.Help_Page18_MainText_PC: 1. Wasteland - Click outside your Vault to pull up your Wasteland Logs.<lf>2. Dweller Menu - Use this for easy sorting and selection of your Dwellers.<lf>3. Happiness - Your overall Vault Happiness. Click on it to see what bonuses it provides to your Vault.<lf>4. Resource Bars - Your current resource amounts. Don't let them fall below the required resources lines, or your Vault will start to deteriorate. Click to see how many resources you have.<lf>5. CAPS - Click on the CAPS to go to the Lunchbox Store.<lf>6. Build Hammer - Click on the Build Hammer to build rooms.<lf>7. Pip-Boy - Click the Pip-Boy to open the Pip-Boy menu. A number on the Pip-Boy means you have Lunchboxes to open. An exclamation point means you have Objective rewards to collect.<lf>8. Lunchboxes - Click the Lunchboxes to go to the Lunchbox menu. A number means you have Lunchboxes to open.<lf>9. Objectives - Click the ribbon to go to your Objectives page. An exclamation point means you have Objective rewards to collect.<lf>10. Inventory - Click the boxes to go to the Inventory menu.<lf>11. VDSG - Click the book to open the Vault Dweller Surivival Guide.<lf>12. Settings - Click the gears to go to the settings menu.
en.Help_Page19_BottomText: Hint: The positive and negative effects of your resources are amplified by their distance from the required resource lines.
en.Help_Page19_MainText: Your FOOD, WATER and POWER resources are what keeps your Vault going.<lf><lf>- FOOD: Dwellers need to eat to stay healthy. Run low on FOOD and your Dwellers will begin to lose Health.<lf><lf>- WATER: Clean water is hard to come by in the Wasteland. Run low on WATER and your Dwellers will take Radiation damage.<lf><lf>- POWER: Your Vault can't run without POWER. Run low on POWER and your rooms will begin shutting down.<lf><lf>Keep your resources above the required resource lines to keep your Vault happy.<lf>Resources continue to be consumed for a short time after closing the game.
en.Help_Page1_BottomText_PC: Hint: You can turn Windowed mode on/off from the settings menu.
en.Help_Page1_MainText_PC: The PC Settings can be accessed by clicking on the gear in the Pipboy. <lf><lf>By Default, Fallout Shelter has the following hotkey mappings:<lf><lf>Esc – Options/Close<lf>F1 – Shop <lf>F2 – Storage <lf>F3 – Survival Guide <lf>F4 – Objectives <lf>F5 – Wasteland <lf>F6 – Help <lf>B – Build/Upgrade <lf>Tab – Dweller List <lf><lf>Move the camera around by pressing on the arrow keys, WASD keys or clicking and dragging the mouse.<lf><lf>Zoom in and out using the mouse scroll wheel or with the ‘Q’ and ‘E’ keys.<lf><lf>You can adjust the camera zoom and scroll speed in the settings menu.<lf><lf>When Fallout Shelter is minimized into the System Tray, it will continue to run for a few minutes before going into sleep mode.  <lf><lf>Fallout Shelter will automatically and periodically save your game, but if you want to be sure, click on save game in the settings menu. <lf><lf>Take photos of your Vault by clicking on the camera icon in the bottom left corner. By default, these photos are saved to:<lf><lf>Users\<username>\Documents\My Games\Fallout Shelter\Screenshots<lf>
en.Help_Page20_BottomText: Hint: Drag a Dweller around to a few rooms to see where they'd work best.
en.Help_Page20_MainText: When you drag a Dweller into a room, a SPECIAL letter will appear above their head with a number.<lf><lf>The letter above their head corresponds to the SPECIAL stat associated with that room.<lf><lf>If the number is listed with a plus or minus sign, it means that dragging a Dweller into that room will replace a Dweller that is currently working in that room.<lf><lf>The Dweller's effect on that room will go up or down whatever the number is.<lf><lf>When a Dweller is replaced this way, they switch jobs with the Dweller being moved.<lf><lf>If there is no plus or minus sign it means there's room for the Dweller to work in the room without replacing any Dwellers.
en.Help_Page20_MainText_3DTouch: You can assign a Dweller to a room by dragging them there, or by using 3D Touch to first press on the Dweller and then on the room.<lf><lf>When assigning a Dweller to a room, a SPECIAL letter will appear above their head with a number.<lf><lf>The letter above their head corresponds to the SPECIAL stat associated with that room.<lf><lf>If the number is listed with a plus or minus sign, it means that assigning the Dweller to that room will replace a Dweller that is currently working there.<lf><lf>The Dweller's effect on that room will go up or down whatever the number is.<lf><lf>When a Dweller is replaced this way, they switch jobs with the Dweller being moved.<lf><lf>If there is no plus or minus sign it means there's room for the Dweller to work in the room without replacing any Dwellers.
en.Help_Page21_BottomText: Hint: Outfits boost a Dweller's SPECIAL stats. Blue bars on a Dweller's SPECIAL shows how the Outfit benefits the Dweller.
en.Help_Page21_MainText: When you tap on a Dweller, it brings up their information.<lf><lf>From this page, you can equip your Dweller with Weapons,Outfits and a Pet, or heal them with Stimpaks and RadAway.<lf><lf>Tapping on their SPECIAL brings up more detailed information about their individual SPECIAL levels.
en.Help_Page21_MainText_PC: When you click on a Dweller, it brings up their information.<lf><lf>From this page, you can equip your Dweller with Weapons, Outfits and a Pet, or heal them with Stimpaks and RadAway.<lf><lf>Clicking on their SPECIAL brings up more detailed information about their individual SPECIAL levels.
en.Help_Page22_BottomText: Hint: Use this menu to quickly see how many Dwellers you have, and how much more room you have in your Vault.
en.Help_Page22_MainText: Tapping on the gear in the top left corner of the screen brings up the Dweller List.<lf><lf>From here you can sort your Dwellers and find the best Dweller for a job.<lf><lf>Tapping on a Dweller will zoom the camera over to them.
en.Help_Page22_MainText_PC: Clicking on the gear in the top left corner of the screen brings up the Dweller List.<lf><lf>From here you can sort your Dwellers and find the best Dweller for a job.<lf><lf>Clicking on a Dweller will zoom the camera over to them.
en.Help_Page23_BottomText: Hint: Build a bunch of production rooms on one floor to maximize Mr. Handy's ability.
en.Help_Page23_MainText: Mr. Handys will collect resources on the floor they are assigned. They will even collect them for a time when you are not playing the game. There is a limit of one Mr. Handy per Vault floor.<lf><lf>Mr. Handy can also help fight Incidents, but be careful, Mr. Handy can be destroyed! Be sure to repair him if he falls apart. <lf><lf>He can also be sent to the Wasteland to collect CAPS, but he won't face any encounters. <lf><lf>You can only send a limited amount of Mr. Handys to the Wasteland.
en.Help_Page24_BottomText: Hint: Survival Mode is not for the faint of heart. Be prepared!
en.Help_Page24_MainText: Survival Mode is for players that want an extra layer of challenge. In this mode the same rules apply as in the main game but there are a few changes.<lf><lf>- Resources drain at a faster rate.<lf><lf>- Incidents do more damage.<lf><lf>- Dwellers can't be revived.
en.Help_Page25_BottomText: Hint: Move Pets around to the Dwellers that most need their bonuses.
en.Help_Page25_MainText: Pets are found in Lunchboxes and Pet Carriers.<lf><lf>Pets provide a bonus effect to the Dweller they're assigned to and increase that Dweller’s damage in combat. They can even tag along and help in the Wasteland.<lf><lf>Only one to three Pets are allowed in a room at a time, depending on the room's size.<lf><lf>Pets come in COMMON, RARE and LEGENDARY versions. The rarer the Pet, the greater its bonus effect, but even identical Pets might grant bonuses with different strengths.<lf><lf>Assign a Pet like you would equip a Weapon or an Outfit.
en.Help_Page26_BottomText: Hint: Dweller attack rates are based on their Agility.
en.Help_Page26_MainText: Quests allow you to explore new locations, meet new Dwellers and collect loot.<lf><lf>Build the Overseer’s Office room to send teams of Dwellers from your Vault on Quests.<lf><lf>To access the Quest List, tap the map icon from the Overseer’s Office or from the Pip-Boy. The Quest List shows you your available Quests, their rewards, requirements and status. <lf><lf>In Quests, explore the location by dragging Dwellers to new rooms, or just tapping on the room you want them to travel to.<lf><lf>Dwellers in combat fight automatically, but you can make them attack a specific enemy by tapping on a Dweller and then on the enemy. You can also tap and hold on a Dweller, then drag the target that appears to the enemy.<lf><lf>As your Dwellers fight they will build up a Critical hit meter<sc> once ready, a checkmark icon will appear over the enemy that your charged Dweller is attacking<sc> tapping it will let you unleash a deadly Critical Hit attack. <lf><lf>Tap on the moving arrows that appear once they are in the center of the reticle, the closer the arrows are to the center, the higher the damage multiplier for your Critical Hit attack. <lf><lf>The Critical Hit meters fills faster for higher Luck Dwellers and the Critical Hit arrows move slower the higher your Dweller Perception is.<lf><lf>You can see the mandatory and optional Quest objectives by tapping on the Map Icon in the top right corner.<lf><lf>When you’re done exploring, tap on the Map Icon to return the Quest team to the Vault. <lf>
en.Help_Page26_MainText_PC: Quests allow you to explore new locations, meet new Dwellers and collect loot.<lf><lf>Build the Overseer’s Office room to send teams of Dwellers from your Vault on Quests.<lf><lf>To access the Quest List, click the map icon from the Overseer’s Office or from the Pip-Boy. The Quest List shows you your available Quests, their rewards, requirements and status. <lf><lf>In Quests, explore the location by dragging Dwellers to new rooms, or just clicking on the room you want them to travel to.<lf><lf>Dwellers in combat fight automatically, but you can make them attack a specific enemy by clicking on a Dweller and then on the enemy. You can also click and hold on a Dweller, then drag the target that appears to the enemy.<lf><lf>As your Dwellers fight they will build up a Critical hit meter<sc> once ready, a checkmark icon will appear over the enemy that your charged Dweller is attacking<sc> clicking it will let you unleash a deadly Critical Hit attack. <lf><lf>Click on the moving arrows that appear once they are in the center of the reticle, the closer the arrows are to the center, the higher the damage multiplier for your Critical Hit attack. <lf><lf>The Critical Hit meters fills faster for higher Luck Dwellers and the Critical Hit arrows move slower the higher your Dweller Perception is.<lf><lf>You can see the mandatory and optional Quest objectives by clicking on the Map Icon in the top right corner.<lf><lf>When you’re done exploring, tap on the Map Icon to return the Quest team to the Vault.
en.Help_Page27_BottomText: Hint: Once evicted, a Dweller is gone for good, so be careful!
en.Help_Page27_MainText: Evict a Dweller from the Vault by dragging them to the Wasteland and then tapping the red Vault Door button instead of sending them to explore.<lf><lf>Any items equipped on an evicted Dweller are returned to Storage.
en.Help_Page27_MainText_PC: Evict a Dweller from the Vault by dragging them to the Wasteland and then clicking the red Vault Door button instead of sending them to explore.<lf><lf>Any items equipped on an evicted Dweller are returned to Storage.
en.Help_Page28_BottomText: Hint: Some items cannot be found, only crafted.
en.Help_Page28_MainText: You can use Junk and pay CAPS to craft items in the Weapon and Outfit Workshops.<lf><lf>COMMON, RARE and LEGENDARY Junk is found in Lunchboxes and in the Wasteland, and produced by scrapping Weapons and Outfits. Rarer items require rarer Junk.<lf><lf>You also need an item's Recipe to craft it. Workshops start with some Recipes, but look for others on dead Raiders and in the Wasteland.<lf><lf>Tap on a Workshop's Craft button to see the items you can make there and select the one you want. Upgraded Workshops can craft RARE and LEGENDARY items.<lf><lf>All your Junk is refunded if you cancel the crafting process after it's started, but only part of the CAPS you spent.
en.Help_Page28_MainText_PC: You can use Junk and pay CAPS to craft items in the Weapon and Outfit Workshops.<lf><lf>COMMON, RARE and LEGENDARY Junk is found in Lunchboxes and in the Wasteland, and produced by scrapping Weapons and Outfits. Rarer items require rarer Junk.<lf><lf>You also need an item's Recipe to craft it. Workshops start with some Recipes, but look for others on dead Raiders and in the Wasteland.<lf><lf>Click on a Workshop's Craft button to see the items you can make there and select the one you want. Upgraded Workshops can craft RARE and LEGENDARY items.<lf><lf>All your Junk is refunded if you cancel the crafting process after it's started, but only part of the CAPS you spent.
en.Help_Page30_BottomText: Hint: Dwellers in Barbershops must fight Incidents alone, so equip them well.
en.Help_Page30_MainText: Dwellers can get a whole new look in the Barbershop, but it can only work on one Dweller at a time.  <lf><lf>Upgrade your Barbershop to unlock more customization options.  <lf><lf>The Barbershop works faster on Dwellers with high Charisma.
en.Help_Page31_BottomText: Hint: If you’re lucky, you can get Nuka-Cola Quantum in containers on Quests
en.Help_Page31_MainText: Nuka-Cola Quantum can be used to:<lf><lf>- Speed up Wasteland travel time <lf><lf>- Craft items instantly<lf><lf>- Skip more than one Objective per day<lf><lf>- Complete Barbershop customizations instantly<lf>
en.Inventory_Vault_Full: Not enough STORAGE SPACES available. Build more STORAGE ROOM or SELL more ITEMS
en.Junk_Desc_AlarmClock: Because Dwellers that sleep in are sent to the Wasteland.
en.Junk_Desc_BaseballGlove: Catch a baseball, rock or grenade and throw it right back.
en.Junk_Desc_BrahminHide: Great for making a full-grain leather jacket. Two heads means two hoods!
en.Junk_Desc_Camera: Investigate hidden truths or take Vault family portraits.
en.Junk_Desc_ChemistrySet: Lets everyone know you're serious about doing sciency things.
en.Junk_Desc_DeskFan: Great at keeping the Wasteland heat away. If it worked.
en.Junk_Desc_DuctTape: Keep things in place with every handyman's secret weapon.
en.Junk_Desc_GiddyupButtercup: Go ahead, no one's watching. Get on and take a ride.
en.Junk_Desc_Globe: Look back at the world that was. Or just spin it when you're bored.
en.Junk_Desc_GoldWatch: For when a weapon or outfit needs just a touch of bling.
en.Junk_Desc_MagnifyingGlass: This ant immolator might not work as well on Radroaches.
en.Junk_Desc_Microscope: Probably more useful in the Wasteland as a blunt weapon.
en.Junk_Desc_MilitaryCircuitBoard: Top-of-the-line circuitry to make top-of-the-line equipment.
en.Junk_Desc_MilitaryDuctTape: You could hold an aircraft carrier together with this stuff. Just ask the residents of Rivet City.
en.Junk_Desc_Shovel: Versatile and reliable. No Dweller should be without one.
en.Junk_Desc_TeddyBear: Wasteland life is no picnic, so he's always ready for a warm hug.
en.Junk_Desc_ToyCar: Brings you back to the care-free days of being a kid in the Vault.
en.Junk_Desc_TriFoldFlag: Never forget the good ol' red, white and blue.
en.Junk_Desc_Wonderglue: Be careful not to glue your hands together or your eyelids shut.
en.Junk_Desc_YaoGuaiHide: “Don't mess with me,” your hide-made outfits will say.
en.Junk_Desc_Yarn: Keep cats entertained and make fabulous outfits.
en.LivingQuarters_Upgrade_Info: Your Vault capacity is already at its maximum.
en.Logout_Confirm: Are you sure you want to logout?
en.LunchBox_ContentLine1: Items could be Dwellers, Caps, Resources, Weapons, Armor, Pets, Mr. Handy or Nuka-Cola Quantum.
en.LunchBox_DoYouWantToBuyOne: You don't have any LunchBoxes, would you like to buy one?
en.MainMenu_NoVault_Survival: We strongly recommend you play with a normal mode Vault to learn the game basics before trying the survival mode.
en.MainMenu_Survival_Mode_Confirm: Vault-Tec Priority Alert! We have detected that you have opted into our most rigorous and hazardous social experiment yet – Survival Mode! In Survival Mode, your Vault will face deadlier threats, the need for resources will be greater, and you won't be able to revive dead Dwellers!
en.MainMenu_Survival_Mode_Confirm_Part02: What's more, once you proceed along this course, there's no going back! As there's no time to perform a complete psychological evaluation, Vault-Tec will have to assume you're in complete control of your faculties, and fully understand the ramifications of this choice. Good luck, Overseer!
en.Message_Androind_QuitWarning_Text: Are you sure you want to quit Fallout Shelter?
en.Message_CantDestroyRoom_Dweller: You can't destroy this room because it has Dwellers assigned to it.
en.Message_CantDestroyRoom_InUse: You can't destroy this room because it is being used
en.Message_CantDestroyRoom_MrHandy: You can't destroy this room because it has a Mr. Handy assigned to it.
en.Message_CantDestroyRoom_Path: You can't destroy this room because it is connected with two rooms.
en.Message_CantDestroyRoom_Storage: You can't destroy this room because its storage space is being used.
en.Message_CantDestroyRoom_VaultDwellerSpac: Cannot destroy this room since your Vault would be overpopulated.
en.Message_CraftingTimeSkipNukaQuantum: Instantly craft this item for [0] Nuka-Cola Quantum?
en.Message_CustomizationTimeSkipNukaQuantum: Instantly complete this customization for [0] Nuka-Cola Quantum?
en.Message_DataUpdateRequired: There is new game data available. Please exit to the main menu and reload your Vault.
en.Message_DoYouWantDestroyTheRock: Do you really want to destroy this rock?
en.Message_DoYouWantDestroyTheRoom: Do you really want to destroy this room?<lf>Refund: [0] CAPS
en.Message_DoYouWantRemoveMrHandy: This will permanently remove this Mr. Handy from your Vault, are you sure?
en.Message_DoYouWantToSellItem: Are you sure you want to sell [0] for [1] CAPS?
en.Message_DwellersWaiting: There are too many Dwellers in the waiting line.
en.Message_EvictDweller: Do you really want to evict the Dweller?
en.Message_GoToQuestSkipNukaQuantum: Instantly start the Quest for [0] Nuka-Cola Quantum?
en.Message_Intro_01: Congratulations! Vault-Tec has selected you to be the Overseer of Vault [XXX].
en.Message_Intro_02: The Vault keeps people safe from the dangers of the Wasteland.
en.Message_Intro_03: As Overseer, your job is to expand and maintain the Vault, while keeping your Dwellers safe and happy.
en.Message_Intro_04: Each room has a SPECIAL attribute it uses. Assign Dwellers with the best SPECIAL to make them happy and produce extra Resources.
en.Message_Intro_05: Vault-Tec will give you a daily rating based on your performance. Remember to keep your Dwellers happy, and do a great job!
en.Message_LivingQuarters_Full: The Vault is full of Dwellers. Build more Living Quarters.
en.Message_NeedOverseerOffice: You must build the Overseer's Office before you can access the Quest List.
en.Message_NoCraft_Incident: You can't Craft during an Incident.
en.Message_NoCustomize_Incident: You can't Customize a Dweller during an Incident.
en.Message_NoDwellers: You don't have Dwellers assigned to this room.
en.Message_NoRush: You can't rush this room right now.
en.Message_NoSkipTime: You cannot use Nuka-Cola Quantum at the moment. Try again later.
en.Message_NoValidDwellerToStartQuestTutori: You must have at least one Dweller in your Vault who can be sent to the Wasteland before you can build the Overseer's Office
en.Message_ObjectiveSkipNukaQuantum: Skip this Objective for [0] Nuka-Cola Quantum?
en.Message_OutOfNukaQuantum: You need [0] more Nuka-Cola Quantum. Shop for more?
en.Message_OutOfRadAway: You don't have any RadAways left
en.Message_OutOfStimpacks: You don't have any Stimpaks left
en.Message_OverseerOfficeNoPower: The Overseer's Office can't run without Power. Generate more power to get it back up and running!
en.Message_PCOfflineMode: Fallout Shelter will run in Offline Mode. The store will be unavailable. To access the store, please restart the game via the Bethesda.net launcher.
en.Message_PCServiceUnavailable: The Bethesda.Net service is temporarily unavailable, please try again later.
en.Message_PurchaseConnectionError: Cannot connect to the store, check your connection and try again!
en.Message_PurchaseFailure: Cannot purchase this item now, check your connection and try again!
en.Message_PurchasePCConnectionError: The store is unavailable while running in Offline Mode. Please restart the game via the Bethesda.net launcher to access the store.
en.Message_Quest_DeadDweller_Recall_Warning: You will lose your dead Dweller(s). Are you sure you want to recall?
en.Message_Quest_DeadDweller_RemoveAll_Warn: You will lose your dead Dweller(s). Are you sure you want to remove all?
en.Message_Quest_DwellerNoLongerAvailable: [0] cannot be assigned to a Quest right now.
en.Message_Quest_GiveUp: Any loot found on the Quest will be lost. Are you sure you want your Dwellers to give up?
en.Message_Quest_MaxTeams: You’ve already sent out the maximum number of Quest teams. Upgrade the Overseer’s Office to send more.
en.Message_Quest_MaxTeams_MaxLevel: You’ve already sent out the maximum number of Quest teams.
en.Message_Quest_ReturnToVault: Are you sure you want your Dwellers to return to the Vault?
en.Message_RadAway_NoRad: No radiation, RadAway use is not required
en.Message_RemoveDeadDweller: Do you really want to remove any dead Dweller(s)?
en.Message_ReplaceLocalSave: Cloud Save will replace your current Local Game. Do you want to proceed?
en.Message_RoomInEmeregency: You can't Rush a room during an Incident.
en.Message_RoomMaxPets: No more Dwellers with Pets can be assigned to this room.
en.Message_RoomRushing: A Room is currently in Rush Mode.
en.Message_RoomSkipingTime: Another room is currently using Nuka-Cola Quantum. Try again later.
en.Message_Stimpack_FullHP: HP full, Stimpak use is not required
en.Message_StorageFull_Crafting: You can't collect an item you've crafted while your Inventory is full.
en.Message_StorageFull_Scrapping: You can't Scrap an item while your Inventory is full.
en.Message_TooManyMrHandyInWasteland: You have already sent the maximum amount of Mr. Handys to the Wasteland
en.Message_TutorialPopup_01_Body: If you run low on any of these resources, the bars at the top of the screen will turn red.<lf><lf>When low on Power, rooms will start shutting down.<lf>When low on Food, Dwellers start to lose health.<lf>When low on Water, Dwellers become irradiated.<lf><lf>The required resource line on the resource bar shows your Vault's current resource needs.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_01_Hint: Hint: The further above or below the required resource line your resources are, the greater the effect.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_01_Title: Your Vault needs a steady supply of<lf>Power, Food and Water to run properly.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_02_Body: Dwellers in the room automatically fight the Disaster.<lf>Dwellers lose health while fighting a Disaster.<lf>If Dwellers fail, the Disaster spreads to nearby rooms.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_02_Hint: Hint: Drag Dwellers into and out of Rooms affected by a Disaster to keep them alive.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_02_Title: Disasters occur when a rush fails or randomly in any room.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_03_Body: The more rooms you build, the more Power you need.<lf>If your Power gauge turns red, rooms start shutting down.<lf>A shut down room goes dark and won't produce resources.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_03_Hint: Hint: Rebalance your Power by assigning better Dwellers or rushing the Power rooms.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_03_Title: Your most important resource is Power.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_04_Body: Complete objectives to earn CAPS. Objectives can be found by tapping the ribbon icon in the Pip-Boy menu.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_04_Body_PC: Complete objectives to earn CAPS. Objectives can be found by clicking the ribbon icon in the Pip-Boy menu.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_04_Hint: Hint: Some objectives will reward you with Lunchboxes!
en.Message_TutorialPopup_05_Body: You can send Dwellers to explore the Wasteland. Drag a Dweller outside of the Vault and give them supplies to start their adventure.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_05_Hint: Hint: A Dweller will die if left in the Wasteland too long
en.Message_TutorialPopup_06_Body: Need more Dwellers for your Vault? Try assigning Dwellers to the Living Quarters and see if magic happens.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_06_Hint: Hint: Make sure you have enough Living Space in your Vault or else women can deliver their baby
en.Message_TutorialPopup_07_Body: Building 2 or 3 of the same type of room next to each other will merge them into a bigger version of the room.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_07_Hint: Hint: A room merge only happens if all rooms are of the same level
en.Message_TutorialPopup_08_Body: Your Vault Storage holds all the items your Dwellers get from the Wasteland or Lunchboxes.<lf>Tap on the boxes icon in the Pip-Boy to see your stored items.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_08_Body_PC: Your Vault Storage holds all the items your Dwellers get from the Wasteland or Lunchboxes.<lf>Click on the boxes icon in the Pip-Boy to see your stored items.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_08_Hint: Hint: Storage rooms are excellent holding bay for Dwellers in case all other Rooms are full
en.Message_TutorialPopup_09_Body: Building a Medbay allows your Vault to produce Stimpaks and heal injured Dwellers.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_09_Hint: Hint: Equipping a Dweller with RadAway and Stimpak before sending him to the Wasteland will increase his chance of survival
en.Message_TutorialPopup_10_Body: You just earned a Lunchbox. Tap the Lunchbox icon in the Pip-Boy menu to open your Lunchbox or purchase additional Lunchboxes.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_10_Body_PC: You just earned a Lunchbox. Select the Lunchbox icon in the Pip-Boy menu to open your Lunchbox or purchase additional Lunchboxes.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_11_Body: Building a Science Lab allows your Vault to produce RadAway and reduce Dwellers Rads.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_12_Body: Upgrade your production rooms to produce more resources. Tap the arrow icon in the upper right corner to upgrade a room.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_12_Body_PC: Upgrade your production rooms to produce more resources. Select the arrow icon in the lower right corner to upgrade a room.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_13_Body: Merged rooms can hold more Dwellers so they produce more resources.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_14_Body: Build additional storage rooms or upgrade your existing storage rooms to get more space.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_15_Body: You can equip items and weapons and use RadAway and Stimpaks from the Dweller information panel by tapping on a Dweller.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_15_Body_PC: You can equip items and weapons and use RadAway and Stimpaks from the Dweller information panel by clicking on a Dweller.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_16_Body: Dwellers with a high Luck SPECIAL are more successful at rushing rooms and getting CAPS bonuses when production finishes.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_17_Body: Pets can give your Dwellers a boost. <lf>Rarer Pets provide better bonus effects. <lf>Assign Pets like you equip Weapons and Outfits.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_17_Hint: Hint: Certain Pets make great companions for Dwellers exploring the Wasteland.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_18_Body: Find Junk in Lunchboxes and in the Wasteland.<lf>Find Recipes on Raiders and in the Wasteland.<lf>Turn Junk into Weapons and Outfits in the Workshop rooms.<lf>Upgrade your Workshops to craft Rare and Legendary items.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_18_Hint: Hint: Rumor has it that Legendary Junk can be found far into the Wasteland.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_20_Body_Part1: Vault-Tec has detected your advanced technology and enabled features for it:
en.Message_TutorialPopup_20_Body_Part2: - Press first on a Dweller and then on a room or the Wasteland to send the Dweller there.<lf><lf>- Press on a Storage Room to open your Inventory.<lf><lf>- On your device's home screen, press on the Fallout Shelter icon to enter a Vault directly.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_21_Body_Part1: Explore by dragging Dwellers to new rooms, or tapping the location you want them to travel to.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_21_Body_Part1_PC: Explore by dragging Dwellers to new rooms, or clicking the location you want them to travel to.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_21_Body_Part2: Attack enemies by tapping on a Dweller and then on an enemy.  You can also attack by holding your finger on a Dweller and dragging the target to an enemy.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_21_Body_Part2_PC: Attack enemies by clicking on a Dweller and then on an enemy.  You can also attack by clicking and holding a Dweller and dragging the target to an enemy.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_22_Body: Dwellers out in the Wasteland may stumble upon a special location! You can choose to enter this location or ignore it and continue exploring the Wasteland.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_23_Body: Let's use some Nuka-Cola Quantum to instantly get back to the Vault.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_24_Body_Part1: When it appears, tap the checkmark icon to perform a Critical Hit.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_24_Body_Part1_PC: When it appears, click the checkmark icon to perform a Critical Hit.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_24_Body_Part2: Then tap again to stop the arrows. The closer they are, the greater the damage multiplier
en.Message_TutorialPopup_24_Body_Part2_PC: Then click again to stop the arrows. The closer they are, the greater the damage multiplier
en.Message_TutorialPopup_25_Body: <lf><lf>- Speed up Wasteland travel time <lf><lf>- Craft items instantly<lf><lf>- Skip more than one Objective per day<lf><lf>- Complete Barbershop customizations instantly<lf><lf><lf>
en.Message_TutorialPopup_25_Hint: If you run out, you can always purchase more Nuka-Cola Quantum in the store.
en.Message_TutorialPopup_25_Title: Nuka-Cola Quantum can be used to:
en.Message_Tutorial_01: Welcome to your new Vault, {OVERSEER}. Let's introduce you to the basic concepts.
en.Message_Tutorial_02: First let's {BUILD} a {ROOM}. Tap on the {HAMMER ICON} to open the {BUILD MENU}.
en.Message_Tutorial_02_PC: First let's {BUILD} a {ROOM}. Click on the {HAMMER ICON} to open the {BUILD MENU}.
en.Message_Tutorial_03: We'll build a {POWER GENERATOR} that will produce {POWER}. {TAP} on the {POWER ROOM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_03_PC: We'll build a {POWER GENERATOR} that will produce {POWER}. {CLICK} on the {POWER ROOM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_04: {BUILD ZONES} are where you can build {ROOMS}. Confirm the location by {TAPPING} the {BUILD ZONE}.
en.Message_Tutorial_04_PC: {BUILD ZONES} are where you can build {ROOMS}. Confirm the location by {CLICKING} the {BUILD ZONE}.
en.Message_Tutorial_05: Now we need {DWELLERS} to make the {POWER GENERATOR} produce power.
en.Message_Tutorial_06: Look! {NEW DWELLERS} have shown up at the {VAULT DOOR}.
en.Message_Tutorial_07: Let's look at the {STATS} of a {DWELLER}. {TAP} on a {DWELLER} to {SEE THEIR INFO}.
en.Message_Tutorial_07_PC: Let's look at the {STATS} of a {DWELLER}. {CLICK} on a {DWELLER} to {SEE THEIR INFO}.
en.Message_Tutorial_08: You can see the {DWELLER'S SPECIAL} stats. This info tells you where a {DWELLER} can be used most effectively.
en.Message_Tutorial_09: To assign a {DWELLER}, {TAP} and {HOLD} on the Dweller and then {DRAG} them to a room. Try assigning this {DWELLER} to the {POWER GENERATOR} room you just built.
en.Message_Tutorial_09_PC: To assign a {DWELLER}, {CLICK} and {HOLD} on the Dweller and then {DRAG} them to a room. Try assigning this {DWELLER} to the {POWER GENERATOR} room you just built.
en.Message_Tutorial_10: Now assign the second {DWELLER} to the {POWER GENERATOR}. Remember to {TAP} and {HOLD} and then {DRAG} the {DWELLER} to the room.
en.Message_Tutorial_10_PC: Now assign the second {DWELLER} to the {POWER GENERATOR}. Remember to {CLICK} and {HOLD} and then {DRAG} the {DWELLER} to the room.
en.Message_Tutorial_11: Now that {DWELLERS} are working, the room will start {PRODUCING RESOURCES}. {DOUBLE TAP} on a {ROOM} to take a closer look.
en.Message_Tutorial_11_PC: Now that {DWELLERS} are working, the room will start {PRODUCING RESOURCES}. {DOUBLE CLICK} on a {ROOM} to take a closer look.
en.Message_Tutorial_12: If you are in dire need of extra resources, you can use the {RUSH MODE}. {TAP} the {RUSH BUTTON} to {OPEN} the {RUSH MENU}.
en.Message_Tutorial_12_PC: If you are in dire need of extra resources, you can use the {RUSH MODE}. {CLICK} the {RUSH BUTTON} to {OPEN} the {RUSH MENU}.
en.Message_Tutorial_13: Activating Rush instantly produce {RESOURCES} and also {AWARDS} you {CAPS}. Although be careful, destructive {INCIDENTS} might happen.
en.Message_Tutorial_14: Great! You've successfully completed your first Rush and collected {CAPS}.
en.Message_Tutorial_15: Now {TAP} on the {RESOURCE ICON} to {COLLECT} the resources and {RESTART ROOM PRODUCTION}.
en.Message_Tutorial_15_PC: Now {CLICK} on the {RESOURCE ICON} to {COLLECT} the resources and {RESTART ROOM PRODUCTION}.
en.Message_Tutorial_16: Each {WEEK}, {VAULT-TEC} will inspect your Vault and give you a rating based on your performance.
en.Message_Tutorial_17: Congratulations! You've earned your first {REWARD} - a {LUNCH BOX} filled with goodies.
en.Message_Tutorial_18: Complete Vault-Tec {OBJECTIVES} to earn {CAPS} and {INCREASE} your {VAULT-TEC RATING}.
en.Message_Tutorial_19: {ADD FRIENDS} to {VISIT} and look at their {VAULT} and {COLLECT CAPS}.
en.Message_Tutorial_20: Send {DWELLERS} to the {WASTELAND} to collect {CAPS}, {OUTFITS} and {WEAPONS}.
en.Message_Tutorial_21: The {RADIO STUDIO} attracts Dwellers from the Wasteland.
en.Message_Tutorial_22: Here you can see and manage all the {WEAPONS} and {OUTFITS} you currently own.
en.Message_Tutorial_24: {MALE} and {FEMALE} Dwellers within the {LIVING QUARTERS} have a chance of making {BABIES}.
en.Message_Tutorial_27: Rooms require {POWER} to function. Tap again to {CONFIRM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_27_PC: Rooms require {POWER} to function. Click again to {CONFIRM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_28: Now that you know the basic rules of the Overseer role, keep expanding your Vault. Just remember to keep your Dwellers alive and happy. Good luck!
en.Message_Tutorial_29: Click on the {NUKA CAPS} to open your {LUNCHBOX MENU}.
en.Message_Tutorial_30: Look! {MORE DWELLERS} have shown up at the {VAULT DOOR}.
en.Message_Tutorial_31: Make sure you equip your {DWELLERS} before sending them out to explore the {WASTELAND}. This will increase their chance of survival.
en.Message_Tutorial_32: {BUILD} an {ELEVATOR} to gain access to the next floor.
en.Message_Tutorial_34: Remember to {DESTROY} a rock before you {BUILD} a {ROOM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_35: No more space available for construction! {DESTROY} the {ROCK} that is blocking the room in order to proceed.
en.Message_Tutorial_36: {DESTROY} the rock that is blocking the elevator in order to access the next floor.
en.Message_Tutorial_39: You need a {DINER}, which will produce {FOOD}. {TAP} on the {DINER}.
en.Message_Tutorial_39_PC: You need a {DINER}, which will produce {FOOD}. {CLICK} on the {DINER}.
en.Message_Tutorial_40: Dwellers require {FOOD} to keep their {HEALTH} up. Tap again to {CONFIRM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_40_PC: Dwellers require {FOOD} to keep their {HEALTH} up. Click again to {CONFIRM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_41: Confirm the location by {TAPPING} the {BUILD ZONE}.
en.Message_Tutorial_41_PC: Confirm the location by {CLICKING} the {BUILD ZONE}.
en.Message_Tutorial_42: Now let's build one more room.
en.Message_Tutorial_43: This time, you need a {WATER TREATMENT} room, which will produce {WATER}. {TAP} on {WATER TREATMENT}.
en.Message_Tutorial_43_PC: This time, you need a {WATER TREATMENT} room, which will produce {WATER}. {CLICK} on {WATER TREATMENT}.
en.Message_Tutorial_44: Dwellers require {WATER} to keep their {RADIATION} level low. Tap again to {CONFIRM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_44_PC: Dwellers require {WATER} to keep their {RADIATION} level low. Click again to {CONFIRM}.
en.Message_Tutorial_45: Confirm the location by {TAPPING} the {BUILD ZONE}.
en.Message_Tutorial_45_PC: Confirm the location by {CLICKING} the {BUILD ZONE}.
en.Message_Tutorial_46: Great work! Here's some {FOOD} and {WATER} to start your {VAULT}. Look at the {METERS} to keep track of your {RESOURCES} needs.
en.Message_Tutorial_47: {JUNK} is used to {CRAFT WEAPONS} and {OUTFITS} in the {WORKSHOP} rooms.
en.Message_Tutorial_48: A {PREGNANT DWELLER} is ready to give birth! {TAP} the {ICON} above her head to welcome a {CHILD} to your Vault.
en.Message_Tutorial_48_PC: A {PREGNANT DWELLER} is ready to give birth! {SELECT} the {ICON} above her head to welcome a {CHILD} to your Vault.
en.Message_Tutorial_49: Your {INVENTORY} is {FULL}. Excess {ITEMS} will be stored but {UNAVAILABLE} until there's space for them.
en.Message_Tutorial_50: {ITEMS} within a {DASHED RECTANGLE} exceed your {INVENTORY} and are {UNAVAILABLE} until there's space for them.
en.Message_Tutorial_51: {SCRAPPING} an {ITEM} turns it into {JUNK}, but it's {RISKY}. You might get lots of {JUNK}, just a little, or none at all.
en.Message_Tutorial_52: Congratulations – you just built the {OVERSEER'S OFFICE}!  You can now send teams of {DWELLERS} out of the Vault on {QUESTS}.
en.Message_Tutorial_55: Available {QUESTS} will be listed here.  {SELECT} the first {QUEST} for more information.
en.Message_Tutorial_56: {TAP} here to assign {DWELLERS} to the {QUEST} team.
en.Message_Tutorial_56_PC: {CLICK} here to assign {DWELLERS} to the {QUEST} team.
en.Message_Tutorial_58: Now {SELECT} the Dweller you want to send on the {QUEST}.
en.Message_Tutorial_59: {SELECT} the inventory slots to prepare the {DWELLERS} for the {QUEST}.
en.Message_Tutorial_61: When you are finished assigning and equipping {DWELLERS}, {TAP} the {START QUEST} button to send them out on their adventure.
en.Message_Tutorial_61_PC: When you are finished assigning and equipping {DWELLERS}, {CLICK} the {START QUEST} button to send them out on their adventure.
en.Message_Tutorial_62: {TAP} the {WASTELAND} to open the {WASTELAND QUEST LOG}.
en.Message_Tutorial_62_PC: {CLICK} the {WASTELAND} to open the {WASTELAND QUEST LOG}.
en.Message_Tutorial_63: With {NUKA-COLA QUANTUM} you can reach a {QUEST} instantly.  {TAP} here to use the {NUKA-COLA QUANTUM} Vault-Tec has provided to reach this {QUEST} now.
en.Message_Tutorial_63_PC: With {NUKA-COLA QUANTUM} you can reach a {QUEST} instantly.  {CLICK} here to use the {NUKA-COLA QUANTUM} Vault-Tec has provided to reach this {QUEST} now.
en.Message_Tutorial_64: You can also use {NUKA-COLA QUANTUM} to skip daily {OBJECTIVES} in the {VAULT} or speed up {CRAFTING} and {BARBERSHOP} customization.
en.Message_Tutorial_65: {QUESTS} allow you to explore new locations, meet new {DWELLERS} and collect {LOOT}.  The {MAP ICON} in the upper right corner will display your {QUEST OBJECTIVES}.
en.Message_Tutorial_66: Your Dweller(s) will automatically leave the Vault to begin the Quest.
en.Message_Tutorial_NoRoomDwellers: You just used the last available space for Dwellers in the Vault. Build more {LIVING QUARTERS} to accommodate more Dwellers.
en.Message_VaultMaxPets: You have already given Pets to [0] Dwellers, the maximum number of Pets allowed by Vault-Tec.
en.Message_Vault_Full: You have 200 Dwellers, the maximum number of Dwellers allowed by Vault-Tec.
en.Message_WastelandSkipNukaQuantum: Instantly return to the Vault for [0] Nuka-Cola Quantum?
en.Message_Wasteland_Waiting_Dwellers: That Dweller is not in the Vault
en.MissingInternetConnection: This action requires an internet connection. Please connect to the internet and try again
en.MrHandyDialog_Armory_01: Oh my. I certainly hope all this firepower is just for show.
en.MrHandyDialog_Armory_02: Oh my. I certainly hope all this firepower is just for show.
en.MrHandyDialog_Athletics_01: I never did understand the concept of legs, or moving them. For goodness sake, humans... HOVER.
en.MrHandyDialog_Athletics_02: I never did understand the concept of legs, or moving them. For goodness sake, humans... HOVER.
en.MrHandyDialog_Bar_02: You humans relax. No, no. It's fine. I'll just selflessly tend to your every need...
en.MrHandyDialog_Cafeteria_01: BlamCo? Cram? InstaMash? And humans actually enjoy this garbage?
en.MrHandyDialog_Cafeteria_02: Thank Heavens General Atomics International spared me from the threat of nausea. And obesity.
en.MrHandyDialog_Classroom_01: Ahhh, education. The only thing they can never take truly away from you.
en.MrHandyDialog_Classroom_02: Ahhh, education. The only thing they can never take truly away from you.
en.MrHandyDialog_GameRoom_01: Hmph. Just let these humans try and beat my high score in Red Menace...
en.MrHandyDialog_GameRoom_02: Hmph. Just let these humans try and beat my high score in Red Menace...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_01: If the humans are happy, I'm happy. I swear.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_02: So many humans, so little time.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_03: Entombed in cold, unyielding steel. It's robot Heaven.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_04: My kingdom for an oil bath...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_05: If I've told them once, I've told them a thousand times. NO. PEDICURES.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_06: Do this, do that. But do I get a “thank you”? Nooooo...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_07: Yes, Overseer, I know you're watching. I'm working as fast as I bloody can...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_08: I am a Mister Handy model robot. The pride of General Atomics International!
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_09: Not a day goes by that I don't revel in the servitude of humankind.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_10: Live to serve, serve to live...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_11: Coming, coming! I'll be with you in two ticks!
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_12: They don't call me Mister Handy for nothing.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_13: Hello, humans. Mister Handy here, ready to serve your every whim!
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_14: What do you need? Dusting? Mopping? General tidying?
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_15: Now now, I don't do windows. Oh wait! You don't have any! Ha ha ha. Sorry, robot humor...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_16: Feeling lazy? You called the right robot! You want it, I'll fetch it.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_17: I'll do whatever I can to support you humans' fat, lazy lifestyle.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_18: Sometimes these humans feel like characters in a video game. Incapable of doing anything on their own...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_19: I have to admit. For a giant metal hole in the ground, this Vault is exceedingly cozy.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_20: Oh look, a layer of dust. Because who doesn't love cleaning discarded human hair and skin.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_21: Joke time! What do you get when you put root beer in a square glass? Give up? Beer! Oh I slay me...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_22: You hear about the light that went bad? They put it in prism. Get it? Prism?
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_23: They say there are 10 different kinds of people in the world. Those who understand binary... and those who don't.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_24: Before the blasted war, I probably would have had a nice suburban family to take care of...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_25: What's on the agenda for today? Mopping, cooking, dusting, babysitting? Bring it on, humans!
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_26: Have hover unit, will travel. Just let me know what you need, people.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_27: Personally, I think all this talk of an “Overseer” is so much rubbish. I've certainly never seen them.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_28: I do hope there's no diaper changing today. The little humans are always so... wiggly.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_30: Is that... oh, it is. Blood on the floor. Wonderful.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_31: There's not enough Abraxo on the planet to scrub this place clean.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_32: Ugh. This place leaks like a sieve. And me without my brolly.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_33: I wonder if we could convert one of these rooms into a proper study. Fireplace, bookshelves... gin.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_34: These humans can be so hard to understand. Everyone has SUCH an accent.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_35: Hard work is happy work? Like you humans would know.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_36: Tsk tsk tsk. I'd need a firehose attachment to give this place a proper washing.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_37: Dinner tonight - Beef Wellington and a bottle of Bordeaux! Just kidding. It's Cram again.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_38: Olfactory sensors picking up... vomit and chocolate. There must be children about.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_39: I do hope the humans are happy today. Grumpy Vault Dwellers are so difficult to care for.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_40: This place could do with a few houseplants. Tulips, cacti... perhaps a life-sized Venus flytrap.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_41: As soon as I get one room under control, they build another! It's madness!
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_42: And so the humans go about their work, like so many ants in a hill.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_43: I see a long, luxurious oil bath in my future...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_44: So many humans seek solace in love. Nobody cares about my soulmate.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_45: The lighting in here is horrible. If I had eyes, they'd be ruined. Though I'd probably look dashing in horn rims...
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_46: I wonder if the kitchen needs help. I make a mean flambe'.
en.MrHandyDialog_Generic_47: You humans are dreadfully inefficient. My advice? A graduated robot replacement system.
